text: Soumitra Chatterjee (19 January 1935 - 15 November 2020) was an Indian actor, playwright, theatre director, painter and poet. He was born in Kolkata, West Bengal. His career began in 1959. Chatterjee was known for his roles in Abhijan, Charulata, Aranyer Din Ratri, Ashani Sanket, Sonar Kella, Joi Baba Felunath, Ghare Baire, Shakha Proshakha, Ganashatru, Akash Kusum, Jhinder Bandi, Parineeta and in Ganadevata. On 12 October 2020, Chatterjee tested positive for COVID-19 and was hospitalized in Kolkata. He also had prostate cancer. Chatterjee died from the infection a month later on 15 November, aged 85.Soumitra Chatterjee, One of Bengal's Greatest Actors, Passes Away ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Kolkata Category:Indian movie actors Category:Indian television actors Category:Indian stage actors Category:Indian theatre directors Category:Indian playwrights Category:Indian painters Category:20th- century Indian poets Category:Actors from Kolkata
